column4: I'm getting really bad speeds transferring files over LAN ? It's much faster in XP for example.. anybody knows a way to fix it / troubleshoot it ?
intel e1000 network card?
nope, i think it's a realtek chipset
are you sure? can you paste the mac-address or do a lsmod?
yes
or do lspci
or something else to test, which network card it is =)
Current MAC: 00:02:44:66:73:77 (Surecom Technology Co.)
i had a similar problem with a thinkpad t60 laptop, but that one has a e1000 card, and i know the fix for that
seems like its surecom
right, never heard of that. sorry =)
could the fix for that e1000 card maybe fix my problem ? or they're not related?
i'm almost sure they're not related, the problem lies within the e1000 kernel module
what average latency do you get, when pinging the other host?
alright, guess i'll have to do a bit of a research.. although i posted the problem on ubuntuforums but still no replies
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 0.121/0.147/0.161/0.013 ms
looks good. my problem was related to peaks of high latency...
it's really weird, im triple booting xp/vista/ubuntu ( settling on ubuntu these days ) .. but I might boot into vista and check the speed
im getting a max of 1mbyte/sec on ubuntu
strange
anyway, gotta go, good luck
alright mate, thanks for trying.. later
